TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TextView extends Android.Views.View implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Views.ViewTreeObserver/IOnPreDrawListener, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Displays text to the user and optionally allows them to edit it.

remarks.para: Displays text to the user and optionally allows them to edit it. A TextView is a complete text editor, however the basic class is configured to not allow editing; see for a subclass that configures the text view for editing.
See ,

In 1.0, the method was erroneously not called after calls. Now, doing if there are any text changed listeners forces the buffer type to Editable if it would not otherwise be and does call this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Views.ActionMode.ICallback CustomSelectionActionModeCallback { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Retrieves the value set in .

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Retrieves the value set in . Default is null.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
If provided, this ActionMode.Callback will be used to create the ActionMode when text selection is initiated in this View.
The standard implementation populates the menu with a subset of Select All, Cut, Copy and Paste actions, depending on what this View supports.
A custom implementation can add new entries in the default menu in its method. The default actions can also be removed from the menu using and passing , , or ids as parameters.
Returning false from will prevent the action mode from being started.
Action click events should be handled by the custom implementation of .
Note that text selection mode is not started when a TextView receives focus and the flag has been set. The content is highlighted in that case, to allow for quick replacement.

Docs.summary: Prints information about this view in the log output, with the tag .

remarks.para: Prints information about this view in the log output, with the tag . Each line in the output is preceded with an indentation defined by the depth.

Docs.summary: Returns true, only while processing a touch gesture, if the initial touch down event caused focus to move to the text view and as a result its selection changed.

remarks.para: Returns true, only while processing a touch gesture, if the initial touch down event caused focus to move to the text view and as a result its selection changed. Only valid while processing the touch gesture of interest, in an editable text view.

Docs.summary: Return the text the TextView is displaying as an Editable object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Text.TextUtils.TruncateAt Ellipsize { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns where, if anywhere, words that are longer than the view is wide should be ellipsized.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns where, if anywhere, words that are longer than the view is wide should be ellipsized.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Causes words in the text that are longer than the view is wide to be ellipsized instead of broken in the middle. You may also want to or to constrain the text to a single line. Use null to turn off ellipsizing.
If has been used to set two or more lines, and * are only supported (other ellipsizing types will not do anything).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Lang.ICharSequence ErrorFormatted { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the error message that was set to be displayed with , or null if no error was set or if it the error was cleared by the widget after user input.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the error message that was set to be displayed with , or null if no error was set or if it the error was cleared by the widget after user input.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the right-hand compound drawable of the TextView to the "error" icon and sets an error message that will be displayed in a popup when the TextView has focus. The icon and error message will be reset to null when any key events cause changes to the TextView's text. If the error is null, the error message and icon will be cleared.

Docs.summary: Returns the extended bottom padding of the view, including both the bottom Drawable if any and any extra space to keep more than maxLines of text from showing.

remarks.para: Returns the extended bottom padding of the view, including both the bottom Drawable if any and any extra space to keep more than maxLines of text from showing. It is only valid to call this after measuring.

Docs.summary: Returns the extended top padding of the view, including both the top Drawable if any and any extra space to keep more than maxLines of text from showing.

remarks.para: Returns the extended top padding of the view, including both the top Drawable if any and any extra space to keep more than maxLines of text from showing. It is only valid to call this after measuring.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool FreezesText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Return whether this text view is including its entire text contents in frozen icicles.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Return whether this text view is including its entire text contents in frozen icicles.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Control whether this text view saves its entire text contents when freezing to an icicle, in addition to dynamic state such as cursor position. By default this is false, not saving the text. Set to true if the text in the text view is not being saved somewhere else in persistent storage (such as in a content provider) so that if the view is later thawed the user will not lose their data.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Text.InputTypes InputType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Get the type of the editable content.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the type of the editable content.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the type of the content with a constant as defined for . This will take care of changing the key listener, by calling , to match the given content type. If the given content type is then a soft keyboard will not be displayed for this text view.
Note that the maximum number of displayed lines (see ) will be modified if you change the flag of the input type.

Docs.summary: Returns whether this text view is a current input method target.

remarks.para: Returns whether this text view is a current input method target. The default implementation just checks with .

Docs.summary: Return whether or not suggestions are enabled on this TextView.

remarks.para:
Return whether or not suggestions are enabled on this TextView. The suggestions are generated by the IME or by the spell checker as the user types. This is done by adding s to the text.
When suggestions are enabled (default), this list of suggestions will be displayed when the user asks for them on these parts of the text. This value depends on the inputType of this TextView.
The class of the input type must be .
In addition, the type variation must be one of , , , or .
And finally, the flag must not be set.

Docs.summary: When a TextView is used to display a useful piece of information to the user (such as a contact's address), it should be made selectable, so that the user can select and copy this content.

remarks.para:
When a TextView is used to display a useful piece of information to the user (such as a contact's address), it should be made selectable, so that the user can select and copy this content.
Use or the XML attribute to make this TextView selectable (text is not selectable by default).
Note that this method simply returns the state of this flag. Although this flag has to be set in order to select text in non-editable TextView, the content of an can always be selected, independently of the value of this flag.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the key listener to be used with this TextView. This can be null to disallow user input. Note that this method has significant and subtle interactions with soft keyboards and other input method: see for important details. Calling this method will replace the current content type of the text view with the content type returned by the key listener.
Be warned that if you want a TextView with a key listener or movement method not to be focusable, or if you want a TextView without a key listener or movement method to be focusable, you must call again after calling this to get the focusability back the way you want it.

Docs.summary: Returns the length, in characters, of the text managed by this TextView

remarks.para: Returns the length, in characters, of the text managed by this TextView

Docs.summary: Return the number of lines of text, or 0 if the internal Layout has not been built.

remarks.para: Gets the line spacing extra space

Docs.summary: Gets the line spacing multiplier

remarks.para: Gets the line spacing multiplier

Docs.summary: Returns whether the movement method will automatically be set to if has been set to nonzero and links are detected in .

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns whether the movement method will automatically be set to if has been set to nonzero and links are detected in . The default is true.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets whether the movement method will automatically be set to if has been set to nonzero and links are detected in . The default is true.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of times the marquee animation is repeated.

remarks.para: Gets the number of times the marquee animation is repeated. Only meaningful if the TextView has marquee enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveCursorToVisibleOffset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor, if needed, so that it is at an offset that is visible to the user.

remarks.para: Move the cursor, if needed, so that it is at an offset that is visible to the user. This will not move the cursor if it represents more than one character (a selection range). This will only work if the TextView contains spannable text; otherwise it will do nothing.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the movement method (arrow key handler) to be used for this TextView. This can be null to disallow using the arrow keys to move the cursor or scroll the view.
Be warned that if you want a TextView with a key listener or movement method not to be focusable, or if you want a TextView without a key listener or movement method to be focusable, you must call again after calling this to get the focusability back the way you want it.

Docs.param: The auto complete text the user has selected.

remarks.para: Called by the framework in response to a text completion from the current input method, provided by it calling . The default implementation does nothing; text views that are supporting auto-completion should override this to do their desired behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCommitCorrection(class Android.Views.InputMethods.CorrectionInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: The auto correct info about the text that was corrected.
Docs.summary: Called by the framework in response to a text auto-correction (such as fixing a typo using a a dictionnary) from the current input method, provided by it calling InputConnection.commitCorrection()}.

remarks.para: Called by the framework in response to a text auto-correction (such as fixing a typo using a a dictionnary) from the current input method, provided by it calling InputConnection.commitCorrection()}. The default implementation flashes the background of the corrected word to provide feedback to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnEditorAction(valuetype Android.Views.InputMethods.ImeAction actionCode) cil managed

Docs.param: The code of the action being performed.
Docs.summary:
Called when an attached input method calls
for this text view.

remarks.para:
Called when an attached input method calls
for this text view. The default implementation will call your action listener supplied to , or perform a standard operation for , , or .

For backwards compatibility, if no IME options have been set and the text view would not normally advance focus on enter, then the NEXT and DONE actions received here will be turned into an enter key down/up pair to go through the normal key handling.

Docs.param: The frozen state that had previously been returned by .
Docs.summary: Hook allowing a view to re-apply a representation of its internal state that had previously been generated by .

remarks.para: Hook allowing a view to re-apply a representation of its internal state that had previously been generated by . This function will never be called with a null state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.IParcelable OnSaveInstanceState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Hook allowing a view to generate a representation of its internal state that can later be used to create a new instance with that same state.

remarks.para: Hook allowing a view to generate a representation of its internal state that can later be used to create a new instance with that same state. This state should only contain information that is not persistent or can not be reconstructed later. For example, you will never store your current position on screen because that will be computed again when a new instance of the view is placed in its view hierarchy.

Some examples of things you may store here: the current cursor position in a text view (but usually not the text itself since that is stored in a content provider or other persistent storage), the currently selected item in a list view.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAllCaps(bool allCaps) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the properties of this field to transform input to ALL CAPS display.

remarks.para:
Sets the properties of this field to transform input to ALL CAPS display. This may use a "small caps" formatting if available. This setting will be ignored if this field is editable or selectable.
This call replaces the current transformation method. Disabling this will not necessarily restore the previous behavior from before this was enabled.

Docs.summary: Sets the right-hand compound drawable of the TextView to the specified icon and sets an error message that will be displayed in a popup when the TextView has focus.

remarks.para: Sets the right-hand compound drawable of the TextView to the specified icon and sets an error message that will be displayed in a popup when the TextView has focus. The icon and error message will be reset to null when any key events cause changes to the TextView's text. The drawable must already have had set on it. If the error is null, the error message will be cleared (and you should provide a null icon as well).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetOnEditorActionListener(class Android.Widget.TextView/IOnEditorActionListener l) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set a special listener to be called when an action is performed on the text view.

remarks.para: Set a special listener to be called when an action is performed on the text view. This will be called when the enter key is pressed, or when an action supplied to the IME is selected by the user. Setting this means that the normal hard key event will not insert a newline into the text view, even if it is multi-line; holding down the ALT modifier will, however, allow the user to insert a newline character.

Docs.summary: Sets the TextView to display the specified slice of the specified char array.

remarks.para: Sets the TextView to display the specified slice of the specified char array. You must promise that you will not change the contents of the array except for right before another call to setText(), since the TextView has no way to know that the text has changed and that it needs to invalidate and re-layout.

Docs.summary: Return the text the TextView is displaying.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Return the text the TextView is displaying. If setText() was called with an argument of BufferType.SPANNABLE or BufferType.EDITABLE, you can cast the return value from this method to Spannable or Editable, respectively.
Note: The content of the return value should not be modified. If you want a modifiable one, you should make your own copy first.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the string value of the TextView. TextView does not accept HTML-like formatting, which you can do with text strings in XML resource files. To style your strings, attach android.text.style.* objects to a , or see the
Available Resource Types documentation for an example of setting formatted text in the XML resource file.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Util.Locale TextLocale { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Get the default of the text in this TextView.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the default of the text in this TextView.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the default of the text in this TextView to the given value. This value is used to choose appropriate typefaces for ambiguous characters. Typically used for CJK locales to disambiguate Hanzi/Kanji/Hanja characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual float TextScaleX { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the extent by which text should be stretched horizontally.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual float TextSize { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the default text size to the given value, interpreted as "scaled pixel" units. This size is adjusted based on the current density and user font size preference.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Returns the total bottom padding of the view, including the bottom Drawable if any, the extra space to keep more than maxLines from showing, and the vertical offset for gravity, if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total bottom padding of the view, including the bottom Drawable if any, the extra space to keep more than maxLines from showing, and the vertical offset for gravity, if any.

Docs.summary: Returns the total end padding of the view, including the end Drawable if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total end padding of the view, including the end Drawable if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total left padding of the view, including the left Drawable if any.

Docs.summary: Returns the total right padding of the view, including the right Drawable if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total right padding of the view, including the right Drawable if any.

Docs.summary: Returns the total start padding of the view, including the start Drawable if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total start padding of the view, including the start Drawable if any.

Docs.summary: Returns the total top padding of the view, including the top Drawable if any, the extra space to keep more than maxLines from showing, and the vertical offset for gravity, if any.

remarks.para: Returns the total top padding of the view, including the top Drawable if any, the extra space to keep more than maxLines from showing, and the vertical offset for gravity, if any.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the transformation that is applied to the text that this TextView is displaying.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Typeface Typeface { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed. Note that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use to get the appearance that you actually want.
